results.title: Waltz of the toreadors
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Independent Artists (GB), Peter de Sarigny and John Guillermin
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers plays six different characters in this raunchy World War 2 comedy set in a Parisian brothel. When the Germans march into Paris, the redoubtable Madame Grenier and her girls bid a sad farewell to her clients, and prepares to welcome the occupying Germans. It is not long before Madame and her girls are working for the resistance which earns them, at war’s end, the gratitude of a very amorous French President who presents Madame Grenier with a plague for the wall of her ‘distinguished house’. Screenplay by Wolf Mankowitz from the play by Jean Anouilh. Cast also includes Dany robin, John Fraser, Cyril Cusack, Margaret Leighton, John le Mesurier, Prunella Scales.

results.title: Waltz mambo
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, John Bird and Andrew Quinn
results.brief_description: Two choreographed dance movements presented in a computer animated form. The film shows a day in the life of three cones in waltz time; a rhumba played and danced by three musical instruments

results.title: Walter the lazy mouse
results.creator_credit: Viking Films, Doubleday Productions and Stanislaw Dulz
results.brief_description: Based on the book of the same title by Marjorie Flack. An animated story about a lazy mouse who learns to provide for himself as he searches for his family which has moved without telling him. Illustrated by Cyndy Szekeres. Narrated by Bob Dishy.

results.title: Walter Spiel
results.creator_credit: James Fitzpatrick and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
A study of the 62 year old news vendor who sells American and foreign newspapers and magazines at his stand on a Los Angeles street corner. The camera establishes the relationship between “Willy” and his consumers as they come to his stand and look through their choices before purchase.

results.title: Walter Lindrum Billiards Phenomenon
results.brief_description: The Great Depression seemed to be the catalyst for the most remarkable chapter in Australian sporting history. During the very depths of the Depression an elite group of our greatest champions reach the pinnacle of their success. Phar Lap and Sir Donald Bradman are the two best known heroes from this period. Sir Henry Opperman was a third member. The fourth, and least known of the fabulous four was Billiards King, Walter Lindrum. The program tells of his humble beginnings and how he overcame hardship and tragedy to completely dominate his chosen sport.

results.title: Walter Kerr, on theater
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Robert Saudek and Joseph Anthony
results.brief_description: Walter Kerr, New York Times art critic, comments on dramatic scenes from five plays and compares them with film segments, pointing out the unique character of live performance, and showing the range of forms and ideas in live theatre. Play excerpts include: “Prometheus” by Aeschylus, “Richard III” by William Shakespeare, “the Importance of being Ernest” by Oscar Wilde, The Serpent” by Jean-Claude van Itallie and “No Place to be Somebody by Charles Gordone. Narrated by Walter Kerr.

results.title: Walter and Milly went to read (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and Karl McPhee
results.brief_description: Study of the reading abilities of children. Walter and Milly are ordinary children encountering the developmental tasks of their respective ages, with the usual successes and failures. Their parents and teachers try to create the best learning environment for the children. Photographer, John Hoskins; editor, Mark Waters; sound, Max Henser, Julian Ellingworth; music, Michael Carlos.

results.title: Walter
results.brief_description: This film acquaints the viewer with a young man - Walter - who has been a paraplegic since the age of three. He is a self-sufficient and cheerful person living alone but visiting his adoptive parent’s home daily for an evening meal. A determined student of architecture at the community college, Walter is also an active participant in the wheelchairs basketball team.
